cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the west-central Gulf, then turning northeast toward the central Louisiana coast and the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central Louisiana coast around Morgan City / Terrebonne-St. Mary parishes

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana eastward to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–45 mph) possible from Friday evening through Saturday near the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rise of 2–3 ft possible along the lower Mississippi River, Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent waterways.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally 12 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding and river rises.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Friday afternoon; brief navigation restrictions likely due to reduced visibility and strong squalls.
